greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Periodic sequence: repeat [1, 5].
comment: Also continued fraction expansion of (5+3*sqrt(5))/10. - _Bruno Berselli_, Sep 30 2011

This sequence can be generated by an infinite number of formulas all having the form a^(b*n) mod c subject to the following conditions. The number a is congruent to either 5,11,13,17,21, or 23 mod 24 and b is of the form 2k+1.
For example: a(n)= 13^(5*n) mod 8, a(n)= 29^(7*n) mod c where c is any number in {6,8,12,24}. (End)
link: Burkard Polster, Juggling, maths and a beautiful mind [From Parthasarathy Nambi, Nov 20 2009]
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,1).
formula: a(n) = 5*(n mod 2)+(n+1) mod 2. - _Paolo P. Lava_, Oct 20 2006
program: (Sage) [pow(5,n,12) for n in range(51)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Nov 25 2009
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
